metadata.description:
This dataset contains the flux measurements from site No.3 eddy covariance system (EC) in the flux observation matrix from 3 June to 18 September, 2012. The site (100.37634° E, 38.89053° N) was located in a cropland (maize surface) in Yingke irrigation district, which is near Zhangye, Gansu Province. The elevation is 1543.05 m. The EC was installed at 3.8 m high, and sampled at 10 Hz. The EC was installed at a height of 3.8 m; the sampling rate was 10 Hz. The sonic anemometer faced north, and the separation distance between the sonic anemometer and the CO2/H2O gas analyzer (Gill&Li7500A) was 0.2 m.
Raw data acquired at 10 Hz were processed using the Eddypro post-processing software (Li-Cor Company, http://www.licor.com/env/products/ eddy_covariance/software.html), including spike detection, lag correction of H2O/CO2 relative to the vertical wind component, sonic virtual temperature correction, angle of attack correction, coordinate rotation (2-D rotation), corrections for density fluctuation (Webb-Pearman-Leuning correction), and frequency response correction. The EC data were subsequently averaged over 30 min periods. Moreover, the observation data quality was divided into three classes according to the quality assessment method of stationarity (Δst) and the integral turbulent characteristics test (ITC), which was proposed by Foken and Wichura [1996]: class 1 (level 0: Δst<30 and ITC<30), class 2 (level 1: Δst<100 and ITC<100), and class 3 (level 2: Δst>100 and ITC>100), representing high-, medium-, and low-quality data, respectively. In addition to the above processing steps, the half-hourly flux data were screened in a four-step procedure: (1) data from periods of sensor malfunction were rejected; (2) data before or after 1 h of precipitation were rejected; (3) incomplete 30 min data were rejected when the missing data constituted more than 3% of the 30 min raw record; and (4) data were rejected at night when the friction velocity (u*) was less than 0.1 m/s. There were 48 records per day; the missing data were replaced with -6999. Moreover, suspicious data were marked in red.
The released data contained the following variables: data/time, wind direction (Wdir, °), wind speed (Wnd, m/s), the standard deviation of the lateral wind (Std_Uy, m/s), virtual temperature (Tv, ℃), H2O mass density (H2O, g/m^3), CO2 mass density (CO2, mg/m^3), friction velocity (ustar, m/s), stability (z/L), sensible heat flux (Hs, W/m^2), latent heat flux (LE, W/m^2), carbon dioxide flux (Fc, mg/ (m^2s)), quality assessment of the sensible heat flux (QA_Hs), quality assessment of the latent heat flux (QA_LE), and quality assessment of the carbon flux (QA_Fc). In this dataset, the time of 0:30 corresponds to the average data for the period between 0:00 and 0:30; the data were stored in *.xlsx format.
For more information, please refer to Liu et al. (2016) (for multi-scale observation experiment or sites information), Xu et al. (2013) (for data processing) in the Citation section.

该数据集包含了2012年6月3日至9月18日的通量观测矩阵中3号点的涡动相关通量观测数据。站点位于甘肃省张掖市盈科灌区农田内，下垫面是玉米。观测点的经纬度是100.37634E, 38.89053N，海拔1543.05m。涡动相关仪架高3.8m，采样频率是10Hz，超声朝向是正北向，超声风速仪与CO2/H2O分析仪之间的距离是20cm。
涡动相关仪的原始观测数据为10HZ，发布的数据是采用Edire软件后处理的30分钟数据，其处理的主要步骤包括：野点值剔除，延迟时间校正，角度订正，坐标旋转（二次坐标旋转），频率响应修正，超声虚温修正和密度（WPL）修正等。同时对各通量值进行质量评价，主要是大气平稳性（Δst）和湍流相似性特征（ITC）的检验。对Edire软件输出的30min通量值也进行了筛选：（1）剔除仪器出错时的数据；（2）剔除降水前后1h的数据；（3）剔除10Hz原始数据每30min内缺失率大于3%的数据；（4）剔除夜间弱湍流的观测数据（u*小于0.1m/s）。观测数据的平均周期为30分钟，一天48个数据，缺失数据标记为-6999。因仪器漂移等原因引起的可疑数据用红色字体标识。
发布的观测数据包括：日期/时间Date/Time，风向Wdir（°），水平风速Wnd（m/s），侧向风速标准差Std_Uy（m/s），超声虚温Tv（℃），水汽密度H2O（g/m3），二氧化碳浓度CO2（mg/m3），摩擦速度Ustar（m/s），稳定度Z/L（无量纲），感热通量Hs（W/m2），潜热通量LE（W/m2），二氧化碳通量Fc（mg/(m2s)），感热通量的质量标识QA_Hs，潜热通量的质量标识QA_LE，二氧化碳通量的质量标识QA_Fc。感热、潜热、二氧化碳通量的质量标识分为三级（质量标识0:（Δst <30, ITC<30）; 1: （Δst <100, ITC<100）; 其余为2）。数据时间的含义，如0:30代表0:00-0:30的平均；数据以*.xls格式存储。
多尺度观测试验或站点信息请参考Liu et al. (2016)，观测数据处理请参考Xu et al.(2013)。

background: The two-source energy balance (TSEB) model was successfully applied to estimate evaporation (E), transpiration (T), and evapotranspiration (ET) for land covered with vegetation, which has significantly important applications for the terrestrial water cycle and water resource management. One-source evapotranspiration estimation models combine the soil–vegetation components into a single source. However, in real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation having different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange. Therefore, one-source models explicitly cannot estimate the surface evapotranspiration accurately because the effect of.

Shuttleworth and Wallace proposed a typical two-source evapotranspiration estimation model in which the energy partition is assumed to occur in both “the above canopy” and “the under soil” cases. Water vapor and heat meet over the reference height in the interior of the canopy. Moreover, the mixed water vapor and heat can only exit through the top of the canopy; the total heat flux is in addition to the fluxes coming from every surface layer. However, the model is complex, having over five resistances that cannot be accurately calculated. In addition, the model includes required parameters and observations that cannot be readily obtained from operational satellite- and ground-based data; therefore, the range of applications of the model is limited.

The TSEB model has undergone several revisions, improving the estimation of soil and canopy net radiation, the aerodynamic resistance of the soil surface, the fractional vegetation coverage observed at the radiometer view angle, the distribution of regional-scale near-surface air temperature, and soil and canopy component temperatures. Because the TSEB model only requires the surface energy balance model with a single measurement of land surface temperature, the original model and subsequent refinements have been widely used to estimate E and T under a wide variety of vegetation types, vegetation coverage, climates, and spatial scales. However, most studies have only evaluated the total fluxes or ET (soil plus canopy) in comparison with measurements using the Bowen ratio–energy balance system, the eddy covariance (EC) system, or the large aperture scintillometer.

Accurately estimating surface fluxes in a strongly advective irrigated agricultural area is a particularly challenging task and is even more difficult when the EC flux measurements of H and LE have an incomplete energy balance closure with respect to the available energy Rn−G0. The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. In this letter, it is shown that there is an overestimation of the component temperatures compared with the observed composite radiometric. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance. In addition, another factor is the strong advective environment in this region.
research objective: In this letter, the ground-measured soil and canopy component temperatures were used to estimate E, T, and ET, which were better validated with observed ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes, and the ET measurements using an eddy covariance (EC) system.

The objective of this letter is to estimate E, T, and ET using the soil and canopy component temperatures observed via a high-resolution thermal camera as inputs to a series TSEB model and to subsequently better validate E, T, and ET using a combination of the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope technique and EC measurements.
challenges: However, the current composite temperature separation approaches are limited in their effectiveness in arid regions. Moreover, E and T are difficult to measure on the ground.

Errors in the derived component temperature were primarily caused by image classification errors; these classification errors varied with vegetation abundance. The higher uncertainty of H estimation is not only caused by the uncertainty of the TSEB model but also due to the increased uncertainty of the EC system, which is 18% when the mean H is small in the irrigated farmland. Due to image pixel classification errors, soil pixels were counted as vegetation pixels, which produced an overestimation of the canopy temperature under the developing vegetation abundance. Alternatively, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance could have produced the uncertainties in the estimated temperatures. In addition, the estimated uncertainty of the incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy may be another source of Rn estimation errors.
methods: In this letter, the field observations were obtained from the Daman superstation installed in the central oasis, which is a 40-m boundary layer tower located at 100.3722° E, 38.8555° N and at an elevation of 1556 m. The meteorological parameters were measured every 10 min and included air temperature, wind speed, humidity at 5 m over the ground, four-component radiations (measured at 12 m above the ground using a four-component radiometer), and turbulent fluxes (measured at 4.5 m above the ground using an EC system with a sampling frequency of 10 Hz). The soil heat fluxes were measured using three heat plates located 6 cm under the ground. A Fluke Ti55 thermal infrared camera was manually operated on a 25-m-high platform on a boundary layer tower to measure the thermal radiation of the cropland approximately every 120 min; the observations were collected as thermal images from approximately 07:00 to 19:00 China Standard Time (CST) during the daytime. The ground-based measurement data were applied to partition ET into E and T applying the Craig–Gordon model.

To evaluate the TSEB model accurately, the soil heat flux was using the ground measurement. In addition, the soil and canopy sensible heat fluxes were estimated using the series TSEB model, and their latent heat fluxes were calculated while solving the energy balance equations (1) and (2), respectively. The soil and canopy component temperatures were calculated using the images obtained with the thermal camera. To calculate the component temperatures, the visible and NIR images were classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Next, the soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures were exacted from the thermal images. Finally, the thermal infrared temperatures were converted to the radiation temperatures using the incoming long-wave radiation from the sky and the soil and canopy emissivities. Next, the simulated radiometric temperatures were validated against the surface radiometric temperatures, which were calculated according to the incoming long-wave radiation observed by the four-component radiometer.
dataset: The experimental area is an artificial oasis that is covered with maize, vegetables, and orchards. Data of day of year (DOY) 170, 173, 176, 192, 195, 231, 252, and 256 were used to determine ET and the ratios of E (E/ET%) and T (T/ET%) to ET during the Multi-Scale Observation Experiment on Evapotranspiration over heterogeneous land surfaces, which was part of the Heihe Water Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER-MUSOEXE).
findings: Our results indicated that even under the strongly advective conditions, the TSEB model produced reliable estimates of the E/ET% and T/ET% ratios and of ET. The mean bias and root-mean-square error (RMSE) of E/ET% were 1% and 2%, respectively, and the mean bias and RMSE of T/ET% were −1% and 2%, respectively. In addition, the model exhibited relatively reliable estimates in the latent heat flux, with mean bias and RMSE values of 31 and 61 W·m−2, respectively, compared with the measurements from the EC system. These results demonstrated that a robust soil and vegetation component temperature calculation was crucial for estimating E, T, and ET. Moreover, the separate validation of E/ET% and T/ET% provides a good prospect for TSEB model improvements.

Our results demonstrated that the TSEB model using soil and canopy component radiometric temperatures, which were obtained from a high-precision thermal infrared camera, can be applied in a strongly advection-irrigated agricultural area. Notably, the results illustrated that the latent fluxes of the soil and vegetation components were successfully separated with reasonable accuracy, as assessed using ground-based measurements. The estimated E/ET% and E/ET% values agreed well with the values observed using the stable oxygen and hydrogen isotopes technique during the early, middle, and late growing seasons. In addition, the TSEB model produced reliable estimations of Rn, H, and LE; the mean biases of Rn, H, and LE were −18, 5, and 31 W ·m−2, respectively, and the RMSEs of Rn, H, and LE were 29, 19, and 61 W · m−2, respectively. This finding suggests that given accurate soil and vegetation component temperatures, E and T can be accurately separated from ET using the TSEB model.
backgroundCn: 双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型成功应用于估算植被覆盖土地的蒸发（E）、蒸腾（T）和蒸散（ET），这对陆地水循环和水资源管理具有重要意义。单源蒸散估算模型将土壤-植被组件合并为一个单一源。然而，在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含具有不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被的混合物。因此，单源模型显然无法准确估算表面蒸散，因为其影响。

Shuttleworth和Wallace提出了一种典型的双源蒸散发估算模型，该模型假设能量分配发生在“树冠上方”和“土壤下方”两种情况下。水蒸气和热量在树冠内部的参考高度相遇。此外，混合的水蒸气和热量只能通过树冠顶部排出；总热通量是除了来自每个表层的通量之外的额外通量。然而，该模型较为复杂，具有超过五个无法准确计算的阻力。此外，该模型还包括一些所需的参数和观测数据，这些数据无法从操作性卫星和地面数据中轻易获得；因此，该模型的应用范围受到限制。

TSEB模型经过多次修订，改善了土壤和冠层净辐射的估算、土壤表面的气动阻力、在辐射计视角下观察到的植被覆盖度、区域尺度近地面气温的分布以及土壤和冠层组分的温度。由于TSEB模型只需要一个地表温度的单一测量值来进行表面能量平衡模型的计算，因此原始模型及其后续改进已被广泛用于在各种植被类型、植被覆盖、气候和空间尺度下估算蒸散发（E）和温度（T）。然而，大多数研究仅评估了与使用波恩比-能量平衡系统、涡动协方差（EC）系统或大孔径闪烁仪的测量结果相比的总通量或蒸散发（土壤加冠层）。

在强烈的平流灌溉农业区域，准确估计表面通量是一项特别具有挑战性的任务，尤其是在涡度协方差（EC）通量测量的潜热（LE）和感热（H）与可用能量（Rn−G0）之间存在能量平衡闭合不完全的情况下。之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面-空气温差不确定性的影响。有时，这种温差由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。本文显示，与观测到的复合辐射温度相比，组分温度存在过高估计的情况。这通常对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。此外，该区域的强平流环境也是一个重要因素。
research objectiveCn: 在这封信中，地面测量的土壤和冠层组分温度被用来估算蒸散（E）、蒸发（T）和蒸散发（ET），这些估算通过稳定的氧和氢同位素以及使用涡度协方差（EC）系统的ET测量结果进行了更好的验证，具体是通过观察到的E（E/ET%）和T（T/ET%）的比率。
这封信的目的是利用高分辨率热像仪观察到的土壤和冠层组件温度作为输入，通过一系列TSEB模型来估计蒸散发（E）、土壤蒸发（T）和蒸散发总量（ET），并随后结合稳定氧和氢同位素技术以及涡动相关（EC）测量更好地验证E、T和ET。
challengesCn: 然而，目前的复合温度分离方法在干旱地区的有效性有限。此外，E和T在地面上难以测量。

导出组件温度的误差主要是由于图像分类错误引起的；这些分类错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。H估计的不确定性不仅是由于TSEB模型的不确定性，还因为当灌溉农田的平均H较小时，EC系统的不确定性达到了18%。由于图像像素分类错误，土壤像素被错误地计为植被像素，这导致在植被丰度发展的情况下，冠层温度被高估。另一方面，忽略大气上行辐射和透射率可能导致估计温度的不确定性。此外，估计的通过冠层的短波和长波辐射透射率的不确定性可能是Rn估计误差的另一个来源。
methodsCn: 在这封信中，现场观测数据来自于安装在中央绿洲的达曼超级站，该站是一座40米高的边界层塔，位于东经100.3722°，北纬38.8555°，海拔1556米。气象参数每10分钟测量一次，包括地面5米处的气温、风速、湿度，12米高处使用四分量辐射计测量的四分量辐射，以及在离地面4.5米处使用EC系统以10 Hz采样频率测量的湍流通量。土壤热通量通过位于地下6厘米的三个热板进行测量。一台Fluke Ti55热红外相机在边界层塔上25米高的平台上手动操作，约每120分钟测量一次农田的热辐射；观测数据在中国标准时间（CST）白天的07:00至19:00之间收集为热图像。基于地面测量数据，应用Craig-Gordon模型将蒸散发（ET）分解为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）。

为了准确评估TSEB模型，土壤热通量使用地面测量数据。此外，土壤和冠层的感热通量是通过系列TSEB模型估算的，而它们的潜热通量则通过求解能量平衡方程（1）和（2）计算得出。土壤和冠层的组件温度是使用热像仪获得的图像计算的。为了计算组件温度，使用最大似然法将可见光和近红外图像分类为土壤和冠层像素。接下来，从热图像中提取土壤和冠层的方向亮温。最后，利用来自天空的入射长波辐射和土壤及冠层的发射率，将热红外温度转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与根据四分量辐射计观测的入射长波辐射计算的表面辐射温度进行了验证。
datasetCn: 实验区域是一个人工绿洲，种植有玉米、蔬菜和果园。使用了第170、173、176、192、195、231、252和256天的数据来确定蒸散发（ET）及其在多尺度蒸散发观测实验中的蒸发（E/ET%）和蒸腾（T/ET%）的比率，该实验是河西水文遥测实验研究（HiWATER-MUSOEXE）的一部分。
findingsCn: 我们的结果表明，即使在强烈的对流条件下，TSEB模型仍然能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率以及ET。E/ET%的平均偏差和均方根误差（RMSE）分别为1%和2%；而T/ET%的平均偏差和RMSE分别为−1%和2%。此外，该模型在潜热通量的估计上也表现出相对可靠的结果，与EC系统的测量值相比，平均偏差和RMSE值分别为31和61 W·m−2。这些结果表明，稳健的土壤和植被组件温度计算对于估计E、T和ET至关重要。此外，E/ET%和T/ET%的单独验证为TSEB模型的改进提供了良好的前景。

我们的结果表明，使用高精度热红外相机获得的土壤和冠层组件辐射温度的TSEB模型可以应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域。值得注意的是，结果表明土壤和植被组件的潜在通量成功地以合理的精度分离，经过地面测量的评估。估计的E/ET%和E/ET%值与在早期、中期和晚期生长季节使用稳定氧和氢同位素技术观察到的值非常一致。此外，TSEB模型对Rn、H和LE的估计也很可靠；Rn、H和LE的平均偏差分别为−18、5和31 W·m−2，Rn、H和LE的均方根误差（RMSE）分别为29、19和61 W·m−2。这一发现表明，给定准确的土壤和植被组件温度，E和T可以通过TSEB模型准确地从ET中分离出来。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而应对这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次密集观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅呈现2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了密集观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is a flux observation matrix in the context of eco-hydrological data collection?

Definition.AnswerEn: A flux observation matrix is a component of a multiscale dataset that includes eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations. It is designed to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes by providing detailed measurements of turbulent fluxes and other meteorological parameters.
Definition.AnswerCn: 通量观测矩阵是一个多尺度数据集的组成部分，该数据集包括涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站。它旨在通过提供湍流通量和其他气象参数的详细测量，捕捉多尺度生态水文过程。

Definition.QuestionEn: What does the 'eddy covariance (EC) system' refer to in the measurement of evapotranspiration?
Definition.QuestionCn: “涡度协方差（EC）系统”指的是在蒸散发测量中使用的一种方法。
Definition.AnswerEn: The eddy covariance (EC) system is a method used to measure turbulent fluxes of heat, water vapor, and carbon dioxide between the land surface and the atmosphere. It involves high-frequency sampling of wind speed and scalar quantities to determine fluxes, which are essential for accurately estimating evapotranspiration (ET) and its components in various environments.
Definition.AnswerCn: 涡度协方差（EC）系统是一种用于测量地表与大气之间热量、水蒸气和二氧化碳的湍流通量的方法。它涉及对风速和标量量的高频采样，以确定通量，这对于准确估计不同环境中的蒸散发（ET）及其组成部分至关重要。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are 'multiscale observations' in the context of eco-hydrological research?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态水文学研究的背景下，“多尺度观测”指的是在不同空间和时间尺度上进行的观察和测量。这种方法可以帮助研究人员理解生态系统和水文过程之间的复杂相互作用。
Definition.AnswerEn: Multiscale observations refer to data collected at various spatial and temporal scales to capture the complex interactions and processes occurring in eco-hydrological systems. They involve a variety of instruments and methodologies, such as remote sensing and ground-based measurements, to provide comprehensive insights into the dynamics of heterogeneous landscapes.
Definition.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测是指在不同空间和时间尺度上收集的数据，以捕捉生态水文系统中发生的复杂相互作用和过程。它涉及多种仪器和方法，如遥感和地面测量，以提供对异质景观动态的全面洞察。

This includes the use of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensing technologies like LiDAR and thermal imagers. By capturing data from nested scales and multiple perspectives, researchers can better understand the interactions between various eco-hydrological processes in complex landscapes like oasis-desert systems.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测技术的整合，例如在黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）中使用的技术，允许在不同的空间和时间尺度上收集多样的数据类型。这包括使用涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪、自动气象站以及遥感技术如激光雷达和热成像仪。通过从嵌套尺度和多个视角捕获数据，研究人员能够更好地理解复杂景观（如绿洲-沙漠系统）中各种生态水文过程之间的相互作用。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges in ensuring the accuracy and reliability of data collected using eddy covariance systems in strongly advective environments?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 在强烈的平流环境中，确保使用涡度协方差系统收集的数据的准确性和可靠性可能面临的挑战有哪些？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: In strongly advective environments, the accuracy and reliability of data from eddy covariance systems can be affected by incomplete energy balance closure, errors in surface-air temperature difference estimations, and uncertainties in determining soil and vegetation component temperatures. These challenges are compounded by the complexity of measuring turbulent fluxes accurately, especially when the mean heat flux (H) is small. Image classification errors, atmospheric upwelling radiation, and transmittance issues can also contribute to inaccuracies in component temperature estimation.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在强对流环境中，涡度协方差系统的数据准确性和可靠性可能受到能量平衡闭合不完全、表面与空气温度差估计错误以及土壤和植被组分温度确定的不确定性等因素的影响。这些挑战在准确测量湍流通量时尤为复杂，尤其是在平均热通量（H）较小的情况下。图像分类错误、大气上行辐射和透射问题也可能导致组分温度估计的不准确。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How can the use of a high-resolution thermal camera and stable isotope techniques refine the estimation of evapotranspiration components in agricultural regions?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 高分辨率热像仪和稳定同位素技术的使用如何精确估算农业地区的蒸散发组成部分？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The use of a high-resolution thermal camera allows for precise measurement of soil and canopy component temperatures, which are critical inputs for the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model. When combined with stable oxygen and hydrogen isotope techniques, these measurements enable a more accurate separation of evaporation (E) and transpiration (T) components of evapotranspiration (ET). By validating these estimates against eddy covariance system measurements, researchers can enhance the reliability of ET assessments, especially in regions with complex advective conditions like irrigated agricultural areas.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 使用高分辨率热像仪可以精确测量土壤和冠层组件的温度，这些温度是双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型的重要输入。当结合稳定的氧和氢同位素技术时，这些测量能够更准确地分离蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）成分的蒸散（ET）。通过将这些估算与涡动协方差系统的测量结果进行验证，研究人员可以提高蒸散评估的可靠性，特别是在像灌溉农业区这样具有复杂平流条件的地区。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the poor availability of multiscale observations in eco-hydrological research?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在生态水文学研究中，导致多尺度观测稀缺的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Progress in the field of upscaling eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. This is due to the complexity of capturing multi-scale eco-hydrological processes, which requires hierarchically nested instrumentation and a sparse network to investigate interactions in diverse landscapes such as oasis-desert systems.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在异质表面上对生态水文过程进行上尺度化的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的限制。这是因为捕捉多尺度生态水文过程的复杂性，需要分层嵌套的仪器和稀疏的网络，以研究如绿洲-沙漠系统等多样化景观中的相互作用。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it challenging to accurately estimate evapotranspiration using one-source models in heterogeneous landscape conditions?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在异质景观条件下，使用单源模型准确估计蒸散发是具有挑战性的。
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: One-source evapotranspiration estimation models face challenges in accurately estimating surface evapotranspiration in heterogeneous landscapes because these models combine soil and vegetation components into a single source. In real landscape conditions, the surface is heterogeneous and contains a mixture of soil and vegetation with different temperatures and resistance to energy exchange, which one-source models cannot accurately account for.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 单源蒸散发估算模型在异质景观中准确估算表面蒸散发面临挑战，因为这些模型将土壤和植被成分合并为一个单一来源。在真实的景观条件下，表面是异质的，包含不同温度和能量交换阻力的土壤和植被混合体，这使得单源模型无法准确考虑。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the causes of errors in estimating soil and canopy component temperatures in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 在强烈对流的灌溉农业地区，估计土壤和冠层组分温度的误差原因有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Errors in estimating soil and canopy component temperatures in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas are primarily caused by image classification errors, which vary with vegetation abundance. These errors lead to incorrect classification of soil and vegetation pixels, resulting in overestimation of canopy temperature. Additionally, ignoring atmospheric upwelling radiation and transmittance and uncertainties in estimating incoming short- and long-wave radiation transmittances through the canopy can contribute to errors in estimating temperatures.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 在强烈的对流灌溉农业区域，土壤和冠层成分温度估计中的错误主要是由于图像分类错误，这些错误随着植被丰度的变化而变化。这些错误导致土壤和植被像素的错误分类，从而导致冠层温度的过高估计。此外，忽略大气向上辐射和透射率，以及在估计通过冠层的入射短波和长波辐射透射率时的不确定性，也会导致温度估计的错误。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What potential challenges arise from the hierarchical multi-scale observation system in eco-hydrological research?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 生态水文研究中的层次多尺度观测系统可能面临哪些潜在挑战？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The hierarchical multi-scale observation system aims to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes, but it faces challenges such as the poor availability of multiscale observations and the complexity of managing a network that includes eddy covariance towers, automatic meteorological stations, and remote sensing instruments. These challenges can hinder progress in understanding and modeling eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 分层多尺度观测系统旨在捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，但面临着多尺度观测数据稀缺和管理包括涡度协方差塔、自动气象站和遥感仪器的网络复杂性等挑战。这些挑战可能会阻碍对异质表面生态水文过程的理解和建模进展。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to establish a multiscale observation experiment in eco-hydrological studies on heterogeneous land surfaces?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，在异质土地表面建立多尺度观测实验的重要性是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to address the challenge of poor availability of multiscale observations needed to upscale eco-hydrological processes. This is achieved through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data, as demonstrated by the HiWATER experiment.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是解决多尺度观测的可用性差的问题，以便对生态水文过程进行上尺度处理。这是通过在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器安装，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，正如HiWATER实验所示。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why are high-resolution thermal cameras used in data collection for estimating soil and canopy component temperatures?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 高分辨率热成像相机用于数据收集，以估算土壤和树冠组件的温度。
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: High-resolution thermal cameras are utilized to provide precise inputs for the TSEB model, which helps in better estimating evaporation, transpiration, and evapotranspiration by accurately capturing soil and canopy component temperatures, crucial for reliable model performance in strongly advective environments.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 高分辨率热成像相机用于为TSEB模型提供精确输入，这有助于更好地估算蒸发、蒸腾和蒸散发，通过准确捕捉土壤和冠层组件的温度，这对于在强烈的平流环境中可靠的模型性能至关重要。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How are multiscale observations structured to capture eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous landscapes during the HiWATER experiment?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测是如何构建的，以捕捉HiWATER实验中异质景观的生态水文过程？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Instruments are arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multiscale eco-hydrological processes. This includes a sparse network for oasis-desert interaction investigation, a superstation within the oasis, and multiple EC towers and automatic meteorological stations in surrounding landscapes like sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations are carried out at the irrigation district scale, with additional remote sensing missions using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行排列，以捕捉多尺度的生态水文过程。这包括用于研究绿洲-沙漠相互作用的稀疏网络、绿洲内的超级站，以及在周围景观（如沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地）中的多个EC塔和自动气象站。在灌溉区尺度上进行密集观测，并使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计进行额外的遥感任务。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the steps involved in processing ground-based thermal infrared camera data to separate soil and canopy temperatures for evapotranspiration estimation?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn:
处理地面热红外相机数据以分离土壤和冠层温度以估算蒸散发的步骤包括：

1. 数据采集：使用热红外相机在特定时间和地点采集土壤和冠层的温度数据。
2. 数据预处理：对采集的数据进行校正，包括辐射校正和几何校正，以确保数据的准确性。
3. 温度提取：从热红外图像中提取土壤和冠层的温度信息，通常需要使用特定的算法或模型。
4. 土壤与冠层分离：应用分离技术（如阈值法、分类法或混合像元分析）将土壤温度与冠层温度分开。
5. 蒸散发估算：利用分离后的土壤和冠层温度数据，结合气象数据和其他相关信息，估算蒸散发量。
6. 结果验证：通过与其他测量方法（如气象站数据）进行比较，验证估算结果的准确性。
7. 数据分析与应用：分析结果并应用于农业管理、水资源管理等领域。
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The visible and NIR images are classified into soil and canopy pixels using the maximum-likelihood method. Soil and canopy directional brightness temperatures are extracted from thermal images. These temperatures are converted to radiation temperatures using incoming long-wave radiation and soil and canopy emissivities. Finally, simulated radiometric temperatures are validated against surface radiometric temperatures calculated from four-component radiometer observations.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 可见光和近红外图像通过最大似然法被分类为土壤和树冠像素。从热成像中提取土壤和树冠的方向亮度温度。这些温度通过入射的长波辐射和土壤及树冠的发射率转换为辐射温度。最后，模拟的辐射温度与通过四分量辐射计观测计算的表面辐射温度进行验证。

Enablement.QuestionEn: How do advancements in remote sensing technologies facilitate the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data in oasis-desert areas?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 遥感技术的进步如何促进在绿洲-沙漠地区收集多尺度生态水文数据？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The advancements in remote sensing technologies such as LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, multi-angle thermal imagers, and L-band microwave radiometers facilitate the collection of multiscale eco-hydrological data by enabling airborne remote sensing missions that capture detailed information over large areas.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 遥感技术的进步，如激光雷达（LiDAR）、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计，促进了生态水文数据的多尺度收集，这些技术使得空中遥感任务能够在大范围内捕获详细信息。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What strategies are employed to ensure the quality control of observational data collected in highly heterogeneous landscapes?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 在高度异质的景观中，确保观察数据质量控制所采用的策略有哪些？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Quality control strategies include sensor calibration, data collection protocols, data processing, and dataset generation, ensuring that all observational data are meticulously checked for accuracy, especially in heterogeneous landscapes like the oasis-desert areas involved in the HiWATER project.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 质量控制策略包括传感器校准、数据收集协议、数据处理和数据集生成，确保所有观测数据经过仔细检查以确保准确性，特别是在像HiWATER项目中涉及的异质景观如绿洲-沙漠地区。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might multiscale observations be difficult to obtain in heterogeneous landscapes for eco-hydrological studies?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在异质景观中，获取多尺度观测数据对于生态水文学研究可能会面临困难，原因如下：
Expectation.AnswerEn: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的限制。HiWATER实验旨在通过在层次嵌套的尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而解决这一挑战。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is the TSEB model's performance affected by uncertainties in surface-air temperature differences, especially in strongly advective environments?
Expectation.QuestionCn: TSEB模型的性能受到地表与空气温度差异的不确定性影响，尤其是在强烈的平流环境中。
Expectation.AnswerEn: The previous sensitivity studies found that the TSEB model performance is mainly affected by the uncertainty in surface–air temperature difference. Sometimes, this difference is dominant due to the errors in determining the surface soil and vegetation component temperatures from the surface composite radiometric temperature. This often leads to the most crucial effect on the TSEB model performance.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 之前的敏感性研究发现，TSEB模型的性能主要受到表面与空气温度差异的不确定性的影响。有时，这种差异由于从表面复合辐射温度中确定表面土壤和植被组分温度的误差而占主导地位。这往往对TSEB模型的性能产生最关键的影响。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How effective do you consider the use of two-source energy balance (TSEB) models in estimating evapotranspiration over heterogeneous landscapes, given the challenges in accurate temperature separation?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 您认为在异质景观中使用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型估算蒸散发的有效性如何，考虑到在准确温度分离方面的挑战？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The TSEB model is generally effective for estimating evapotranspiration, especially when soil and vegetation component temperatures are accurately measured. However, its effectiveness can be limited by errors in composite temperature separation, particularly in arid regions or when classification errors occur due to varying vegetation abundance.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: TSEB模型通常在估算蒸散发方面有效，尤其是在土壤和植被组分温度被准确测量的情况下。然而，在干旱地区或由于植被丰度变化导致的分类错误时，其有效性可能会受到复合温度分离错误的限制。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand why the data collection methods in eco-hydrology can't capture multiscale observations effectively.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白为什么生态水文学中的数据收集方法无法有效捕捉多尺度观测。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The challenges in capturing multiscale observations in eco-hydrology arise from the poor availability of multiscale data. HiWATER addresses this challenge by using a hierarchically nested scale approach with various instruments, such as eddy covariance towers and automatic meteorological stations, to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 在生态水文学中，捕捉多尺度观测的挑战源于多尺度数据的稀缺性。HiWATER通过采用分层嵌套尺度的方法，利用涡度协方差塔和自动气象站等各种仪器，来获取多尺度和多学科的数据。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm unsure about how multiscale datasets are generated and quality controlled in the context of the HiWATER experiment.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对HiWATER实验中多尺度数据集的生成和质量控制感到不确定。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Multiscale datasets in the HiWATER experiment are generated through a combination of ground-based measurements, such as eddy covariance towers, and airborne remote sensing technologies like LiDAR and imaging spectrometers. The data undergo rigorous quality control, including sensor calibration and data processing, to ensure reliability, and are made available through platforms like figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
Assertion.AnswerCn: HiWATER实验中的多尺度数据集是通过地面测量（如涡度协方差塔）和航空遥感技术（如激光雷达和成像光谱仪）的结合生成的。这些数据经过严格的质量控制，包括传感器校准和数据处理，以确保可靠性，并通过figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心等平台提供。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the methodologies used for partitioning evapotranspiration into soil evaporation and plant transpiration, and discuss their effectiveness in heterogeneous terrains.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析用于将蒸散发分为土壤蒸发和植物蒸腾的分区方法，并讨论它们在异质地形中的有效性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Methodologies for partitioning evapotranspiration (ET) into evaporation (E) and transpiration (T) involve using the two-source energy balance (TSEB) model combined with field observations. Ground-based data, such as soil and canopy component temperatures, are used alongside thermal infrared images to estimate and validate E and T. The TSEB model, when applied in strongly advective irrigated agricultural areas, demonstrates reliable estimates of E/ET% and T/ET% ratios, though challenges like composite temperature separation in arid regions persist.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 将蒸散发（ET）划分为蒸发（E）和蒸腾（T）的方法论涉及使用双源能量平衡（TSEB）模型结合现场观测数据。地面观测数据，如土壤和冠层组分温度，与热红外图像一起用于估计和验证E和T。当TSEB模型应用于强烈的平流灌溉农业区域时，能够可靠地估计E/ET%和T/ET%比率，尽管在干旱地区存在复合温度分离等挑战。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please suggest potential strategies for enhancing the multiscale observational capacity in eco-hydrological studies within oasis-desert systems.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请建议潜在策略，以增强绿洲-沙漠系统中生态水文研究的多尺度观测能力。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Enhancing multiscale observational capacity in eco-hydrological studies can be achieved through hierarchical nesting of observational instruments, such as eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations. Incorporating hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing tools like LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, and multi-angle thermal imagers, alongside ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis, can capture diverse eco-hydrological processes. These methods provide comprehensive datasets for understanding interactions across oasis-desert systems.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在生态水文研究中，通过层次嵌套观测仪器（如涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站）可以增强多尺度观测能力。结合超高分辨率的空中遥感工具，如激光雷达、成像光谱仪和多角度热成像仪，以及对植被动态和光合作用的地面测量，可以捕捉多样的生态水文过程。这些方法提供了全面的数据集，以理解绿洲-沙漠系统之间的相互作用。
